content.question: A charged capacitor, an inductor, an ammeter, and an open switch are connected as shown. The switch is then closed. Which pair of graphs correctly shows the current <math alttext="I of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> measured by the ammeter and the potential difference <math alttext="delta V of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> measured by the voltmeter as functions of time where <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> corresponds to the moment the switch is closed?

choices.label: Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal curve in the first and fourth quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In each graph, the horizontal axis is labeled t, and no values are indicated along it. The vertical axis is labeled I of t in the first graph, the vertical axis is labeled delta V of t in the second graph, and no values are indicated along them. The first figure is described as follows. The curve begins halfway up the vertical axis above the origin at a peak, has one trough and one additional peak, and intersects the horizontal axis twice. The second figure is described as follows. The curve begins halfway up the vertical axis above the origin at a peak, has one trough and one additional peak, and intersects the horizontal axis twice.

Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal curve in the first and fourth quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In each graph, the horizontal axis is labeled t, and no values are indicated along it. The vertical axis is labeled I of t in the first graph, the vertical axis is labeled delta V of t in the second graph, and no values are indicated along them. The first figure is described as follows. The curve begins halfway up the vertical axis above the origin at a peak, has one trough and one additional peak, and intersects the horizontal axis twice. The second figure is described as follows. The curve begins at the origin, has one peak and one trough with absolute magnitudes of one fourth of the way up the vertical axis, and intersects the horizontal axis three times.

content.answer: Two figures are shown. Each figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal curve in the first and fourth quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. In each graph, the horizontal axis is labeled t, and no values are indicated along it. The vertical axis is labeled I of t in the first graph, the vertical axis is labeled delta V of t in the second graph, and no values are indicated along them. The first figure is described as follows. The curve begins at the origin, has one peak and one trough with absolute magnitudes of one fourth of the way up the vertical axis, and intersects the horizontal axis three times. The second figure is described as follows. The curve begins halfway up the vertical axis above the origin at a peak, has one trough and one additional peak, and intersects the horizontal axis twice.
